PopulationController
class PopulationController extends Object
Handling populating the maze with level difficulty @author: Toan Nguyen

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PopulationController getInstance()
      Get instance for singleton design

    • loadTheMaze

      void loadTheMaze(int theHeight, int theWidth, int theEntranceID, Room[][] theMap)
      Load the maze to populate
      Parameters:
      theHeight - height of the maze
      theWidth - width of the maze
      theEntranceID - ID of the entrance
      theMap - the maze

    • loadTheMonster

      private void loadTheMonster(int theDifficultyLevel)
      Fill the monsters spawn pool
      Parameters:
      theDifficultyLevel - the level of difficulty Level 1 (Easy): the pool will contain 60% level 1 Monster (Gremlin), 40% Level 2 Monster (Skeleton), 10% level 3 Monster (Ogre); Total monster is nearly 50% the size of the map Level 2 (Medium): the pool will contain 50% level 1 Monster (Gremlin), 30% Level 2 Monster (Skeleton), 20% level 3 Monster (Ogre); Total monster is nearly 75% the size of the map Level 3 (Hard): the pool will contain 25% level 1 Monster (Gremlin), 35% Level 2 Monster (Skeleton), 40% level 3 Monster (Ogre); Total monster is nearly 100% the size of the map

    • populaceMaze

      Room[][] populaceMaze(int theDifficultyLevel)
      Populace the maze Monsters won't be spawned in the entrance Pillar can only be spawn in a room where there is a monster, there will always be 4 pillars
      Returns:
      theMap with all the monsters and pillars populated
